intro: Physaria spatulata, commonly known as the spoonleaf bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of spoon-shaped, hairy leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers in late spring. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Physaria spatulata is adapted to arid environments and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
